Index dosing intervals

Source: R/nif_class.R
index_dosing_interval.Rd

This function adds a column DI that indicates the dosing interval. All baseline observations before the first dosing interval get assigned to the first dosing interval, too. In addition to DI, the function also calls index_nif(), thus creating the field REF as a side effect.

Usage

index_dosing_interval(obj)

Arguments

obj

The NIF object.

Value

A new NIF object.

Examples

head(index_dosing_interval(examplinib_fe_nif))
#>   REF ID    STUDYID           USUBJID AGE SEX  RACE HEIGHT WEIGHT      BMI
#> 1   1  1 2023000400 20230004001020001  22   0 WHITE  175.3   88.2 28.70151
#> 2   2  1 2023000400 20230004001020001  22   0 WHITE  175.3   88.2 28.70151
#> 3   3  1 2023000400 20230004001020001  22   0 WHITE  175.3   88.2 28.70151
#> 4   4  1 2023000400 20230004001020001  22   0 WHITE  175.3   88.2 28.70151
#> 5   5  1 2023000400 20230004001020001  22   0 WHITE  175.3   88.2 28.70151
#> 6   6  1 2023000400 20230004001020001  22   0 WHITE  175.3   88.2 28.70151
#>                   DTC TIME NTIME TAFD TAD PCELTM EVID AMT ANALYTE CMT PARENT
